description.narrative: NRC develops and implements Humanitarian Mediation in Mali, CAR and DRC. Based on conflict sensitive context analyses, mediation teams facilitate or lead inclusive dialogue and mediation on local level to reduce risks and vulnerabilities to armed conflict.

Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) genomför och utvecklar humanitär medling i konfliktdrabbade samhällen i CAR, DRK och Mali. Utifrån konfliktkänsliga kontextanalyser arbetar specialutbildade medlingsteam för att facilitera och leda inklusiv dialog och medling på lokal nivå för att minska risken för och utsatthet för våldsam konflikt. Till insatsen hör också en lärandekomponent för att dokumentera och fånga upp erfarenheter och kunskap till förmån för den bredare dialogen kring skärningspunkten humanitär verksamhet och fredsbyggande.
Bedömningspromemorian skrivs på engelska med anledning av att engelskspråkig personal i Fält är delaktig i beredning och uppföljning av insatsen, i enlighet med Generaldirektörens beslut om Sidas språkvalsmatris med tillämpningsanvisningar från den l mars 2013.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: In all three countries the programme is on track and are delivering results as per the grant agreement. Given that the programme is considered a "pilot" in some sense institutionalising Humanitarian Mediation within NRC and the wider humanitarian community in CAR, DRC and Mali has been somewhat the focus for the first year of implementation. Nevertheless, there are some tangible results, including for example in Mali under the objective "Improving Safety and Security of Civilians", some anecdotal evidence and informal monitoring by the NRC team shortly after the conclusion of the Humanitarian Mediation process suggests that tensions between the conflicting parties have reduced and the agreed solutions respected. More clarity and detail will be obtained once monitoring (in accordance with the M&E framework) is carried out from April 2019 and onwards. Another example is from CAR where a Humanitarian Mediation process was carried out in Dekoa in May 2018. The process addressed the issue of safety and security in the town, and more specifically the open carrying of weapons. The different parties to the mediation agreed to the creation of a joint “Sensibilisation Committee” where representation and key roles were evenly distributed. The Committee set as its objective to systematically and jointly engage with the community and weapons bearers to encourage them to not openly carry weapons in town. During a follow-up meeting in July 2018 the Committee explained that since they began their work there had been a noticeable reduction of weapons being openly carried. This had reduced feelings of insecurity amongst the population, leading to improved freedom of movement. The Committee was seeking to expand the approach and activities to other towns in the area.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
